intro: Pilosella petraea, commonly known as the rock pilosella, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its hairy leaves and compact growth habit help it withstand harsh environmental conditions. Pilosella petraea is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
